title: Conflict Resolution
description: When Michael takes over conflict resolution duties from HR, chaos ensues at Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: So, uh... you found a band for your wedding yet?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: 'Cause I'm in a band. We really rock.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I mean it's inevitable. I definitely overhear some wedding preparation, but I'm fine with it. She hears me arranging my social life. And we both have to hear Dwight order deer urine over the Internet, so it evens out.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh I got the 'Save The Date'.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah, pretty stationery.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, thanks!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I didn't get mine yet.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There are a few people I decided not to invite, and that might make things kind of awkward but ...  it's my wedding. And I don't want anyone there who has called me a hussy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, thanks, Fantastic Sam's. Adult Cut Plus. Comes with a shampoo and blow dry. We're doing I.D. photos today. Gotta represent.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Uh, on or off?

quotes.speaker: I.D. Photographer
quotes.text: Off.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Okay... [removes glasses]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh! What is on your face? Is that a disguise?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [leaving the room] Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Clown paint.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I.D. badges are long overdue. Security in this office park is a joke. Last year, I came to work with my spud gun in a duffel bag. I sat at my desk all day, with a rifle that shoots potatoes at 60 pounds per square inch. Can you imagine if I was deranged?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's a nice tie.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is... who makes that?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um, I don't...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do you mind if I wear that for the photo?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Um...  let's um, let's keep our clothes.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's like child abuse. I say, if Jesus saw that, he'd freak out! He'd freak out, Toby! I mean on some levels... it's... and I'm supposed to work there. I'm supposed...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [walking into the Conference room] What's the dealio?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Just letting Oscar vent a little. We would use the break room, but the photographer's back there today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What's the problem?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Angela!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It's just a little dispute over a poster in their workspace.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Since Christmas.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So what, you're having a little spat. I forget, are you guys dating?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Michael, can I talk to you for a uh, second please?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Here's how I usually handle this: all I do is listen.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: These things just have a way of working themselves out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: It's like if you write someone a letter, when you're really angry... they say to keep it in a drawer for a couple days. Then you just never end up sending it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do you know about conflict resolution? Your answer to everything is to get divorced. So...

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay... what?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: That was the right decision for me and my marriage.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well... that's not gonna fly here. Because in this office, it is till death do us part... assuming we don't get downsized. [leans over to Pam] Uh, Pam, will you get Angela and meet us in the conference room please?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [holding up a binder] A mediator's tool chest. Okay, well, before we get started, you should know that are 5 different styles of conflict.[in a comedic voice] My Shaolin temple style defeats your monkey style.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Can we go? I have a lot of work to do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. Okay, this is important. The first style is lose/lose.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: What's the next one?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just hold on, please! Okay, if we do lose/lose, neither of you gets what you want. Do you understand? You... you would both lose. Now I need to ask you, do you want to pursue a lose/lose negotiation?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Can we just skip to whatever number 5 is - win/win or whatever?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Win/Win is number four and number five is win/win/win. The important difference here is with win/win/win, we all win. Me too. I win for having successfully mediated a conflict at work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [in front of poster] Okay, since this is the disputed poster. Now, one at a time, I want you to express your feelings using "I" emotion language and no judging or "you" statements.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I got this poster for Christmas, and I feel I want to see it everyday. It makes me feel like the babies are the true artists, and God has a really cute sense of humor.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on, seriously, that?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't like looking at it. It's creepy, and in bad taste, and it's just offensive to me. It makes me think of the horrible, frigid stage mothers who force the babies into it. It's kitsch. It's the opposite of art. It destroys art. It destroys souls. This is so much more offensive to me than hardcore porno. I'm talking about the...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, okay. Stop, stop, stop! Let's see if we can just brainstorm and find some creative alternatives that are win/win.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Win!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. Thank you, Pam. How about Angela makes the poster into a t-shirt, which Oscar wears. That way, he can never see it and whenever she looks at Oscar, she can see it. Win/win/win.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: That's... no...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay... well, brainstorm. Own the solution.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: How about, I leave it up?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: How 'bout, she takes it down?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How about, Angela can keep it up on Tuesdays and Thursdays?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, that is called a compromise. And it is style 3. And it is not ideal. To sum up, win/win - make the poster into a t-shirt, win/lose - take the poster down, compromise - Tuesdays and Thursdays. And the answer is... make the poster into a t-shirt! Win/win.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Win.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: But, it...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [claps his hands twice] It is done!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Win

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: [snaps a photo of Creed, then Creed turns to the side for a profile shot] No, you're all good.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Great. [gets up and leaves]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Angela.[hands her a Save The Date card] I didn't have your zip code.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It was hand delivered. But, I did get a Save The Date after all. It's not my taste.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You solved it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, good.  We can, uh, throw that one out. [shuffles through papers]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are those all the other complains?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Mmm-Hm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I would like to see those please.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I... I can't do that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You can't do that, huh? Huh, ok. Now you and I have a conflict. I order you to give me that file.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: That... [shakes head and places hand over the file]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. [yanks the file away, despite Toby's resistance] There! No more conflict. [looks at the camera] I had to use win/lose on that. It was not pretty. [looks back at Toby] All right... is that it?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [sighs and pulls out a box under his desk] It's all Dwight's.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Every Friday at 4, I have a standing appointment with Dwight for him to file a grievance against Jim. I tell him that I'm sending them to a special file in New York. That box is the special file in New York.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ohh... God. Alright. Why do I have to do everything?

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: Are you sure? [looks at Oscar, who is front of the camera, holding the baby poster in front of his chest]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, he's sure. Just shoot.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: [shoots twice]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [looking through papers in the complaint box] This is from Kevin. He says Stanley uses his Miracle Whip without asking. Meredith complains that everyone talks too loud in the morning and the lights are too bright. Creed... huh. Duh, duh. Creed is sick of looking at the redhead all day and wants a seat facing the receptionist.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You will notice that not one of these complaints is against me.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Actually, I have a separate folder for complaints against Michael. This [unlocks a drawer]is January through March of this year. [pulls out a fairly large folder]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How many of you have at one time gone to Toby to complain about another employee? [looks at all the employees, most of whom raise their hands] And... did you get what you wanted, or were you merely listened to, you forget about your problem, and you move on? [employees mumble "merely listen to and forgotten..." ] That is outrageous! I love this place... and it pains me to see all of the negativity festering... [sighs] Okay, today we are going to get everything out of these files and into the open, where it can be resolved. Alright, how about the Phyllis/Angela dispute?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You already did me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's what she said. [Jim mouths these words along with Michael] The thing is, Angela... you are in here an awful lot. You have complained about everybody in the office, except Dwight, which is odd because everyone else has had run ins with Dwight. Toby, by the way, what does "redacted" mean? There is a file full of complaints in here marked "redacted"... ?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah, it just means whoever complained came to me later and withdrew it, so I took their name off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, ok. There were a bunch of complaints about Dwight that were put in the redacted file about six months ago.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Whoa.. wha... wait. If someone has a problem with me, why would they withdraw it six months ago?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [notices Angela's intense concern] Um... let's move on. I volunteer. Did anyone have a problem with me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, Pamela. Come on down! Let's do it! And [looks through the file]... okay. Just one complaint. Actually, it has been withdrawn. So that is no help to us. Next.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wait, what did it say?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh... [reading]"Does she have to plan her wedding on office time? Couldn't she do that at home?" [Pam looks Angela an angry look] Who else? Why don't we just warm up first? Warm up emotionally, all right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have this kind of big secret about Angela. And I've been really nice to her... and I haven't told anyone. And what the hell?!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here is a Kelly complaint: "Ryan never returns my calls." Ugh, join the club.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: My voicemail's really spotty... sometimes...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I didn't file a complaint. I was just talking.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: To your HR representative.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: To my friend, I thought. I want that withdrawn.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Fine, I'll take your name off. [looks at Michael] So no one will know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [crumbles up the complaint paper] Makin' progress. [Jim raises his hand] Yes?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight tried to kiss me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And I didn't tell anyone because I'm not really sure how I feel about it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That is not true. Redact it. Redact it!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, I'm not actually making a formal complaint. I just really think we should talk about it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, question. [looks at Toby] When a name is withdrawn, does that also apply to the permanent misbehavior file in New York?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stanley. [off camera]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [gets up and walks over to Angela, whispering to her] Hey. Thanks for ratting me out!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [still of camera] You got a lot of anger under there buddy. Come on start us out. Unleash it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I didn't do it! [Michael and Stanley continue to talk off camera, but it's inaudible]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I find that hard to believe... considering you have problems with every single person in this entire office except Bobblehead Joe.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Someone complained that the men's room is "whites only". Stanley, you know that's not true.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I didn't say that.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Then why is there a picture of a white man on the door? [Michael, along with the camera, look at the standard stick man on the bathroom door.]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, Phyllis. You complained that Angela's giving you dirty looks. And you tried to get off the party planning committee.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: No, I never said any such thing. Angela and I are close.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And... also, Phyllis, Stanley says that you cry too much, and that bugs him.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Stanley and I are close, too.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: We sit close.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh... ok.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [sits down for his ID picture] Just take it. [flashes goes off, while he is standing back up again]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can't believe Angela. I went against my better judgment, and I gave her a Save The Date. And now it turns out she complained about me to Toby.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, it was redacted. Look, if she wants an invite, maybe she's just trying to be friends.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Don't take her side.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [sighs] Well, what does Roy think about everything?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know. I try not to bother him about this kind of stuff.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You mean your thoughts and feelings?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I know you keep saying it's your space, even though there's no assigned parking, but I keep forgetting.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes, that's the problem.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I guess so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, well... all settled, then.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [whispering to Angela] I don't like you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, Ryan.  You told Toby that Creed has a distinct old man smell?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I know exactly what he's talking about. I sprout mung beans on a damp paper towel in my desk drawer. Very nutritious. But they smell like death.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right, Kevin. You are accused of making sexually suggestive remarks to Angela that made her feel uncomfortable. Solution:  Angela, you are to make sexually suggestive remarks to Kevin that will make him uncomfortable.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I accept your decision!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey... you know what, Dwight? Maybe we should get our photo I.D. taken together.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That doesn't make any sense.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, it saves time, you know. 'Cause we could just meet in the parking lot every morning. Walk in together. Perfect.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: [to Dwight, who is sitting in front of the camera] Smile.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I never smile if I can help it. Showing one's teeth is a submission signal in primates. When someone smiles at me, all I see is a chimpanzee begging for its life.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This came out really well. [picks up Dwight's I.D. from the laminating machine and hands it to Dwight] There you go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is humongous. I am not a security threat...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And my middle name is 'Kurt', not 'Fart'.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What did I write?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have another complaint for Jim's permanent file.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Talk to Michael. I gave him the box.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What box?!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: But I didn't report your snoring-

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Wednesdays, tearful. Tuesdays... [Dwight walks in and rummages through his complaint box]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh. Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ah... agh... dgh... Ahh! No, no! Four years of malfeasance unreported. This cannot stand.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay! Calm down.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No! You calm down! Who's side is Toby on? Who's side are you on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Him or me?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Him or me? I cannot work with Jim anymore.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Either he goes, or I go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You choose!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: One of us is out of here by the end of today! [runs out]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh... kay...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am not bluffing!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Do the right thing here, Michael. Okay, I have served you loyally for years.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I deserve this. You know I do!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [picks up Dwight's I.D. and snickers] You know your I.D. says you're a security threat?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You have till five.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, look, Jim. There's a sales manager position open in Stamford. Want me to call Jan and tell her you're interested? I could put in a good word for you, 'cause I'll still be working here. Transfer! Transfer! Everybody! Transfer! Transfer! Transfer! Transfer!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay... you two, in the conference room with me. Nobody leaves until we work this out. Cage match!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cage matches? Yeah, they work. How could they not work? If they didn't work, everybody would still be in the cage.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, so Dwight, in your own words - [reads from complaint paper] "Someone replaced all my pens and pencils with crayons. I suspect Jim Halpert." [flips to another paper] "Everyone has called me 'Dwayne' all day. I think Jim Halpert paid them to."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [laughs] Yes! Five bucks each. And it was totally worth it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [reading] "This morning, I found a bloody glove in my desk drawer and Jim Halpert tried to convince me I committed murder. I think he may be the real murderer." [flips to another paper] "Jim Halpert said there was an abandoned infant in the woman's room. When I went to save the child, I saw Meredith on the can."  Gah. "This morning, I knocked myself in the head with the phone."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That actually took a while. I had to put, uh, more and more nickels into his handset, till he got used to the weight, and then I just... took 'em all out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [reading] "Every time I typed my name, it said 'Diapers'."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just a simple macro. You know, these actually don't sound that funny one after another. But he does deserve it, though.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: "By the end of the day, my desk was about two feet closer to the copier."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I just moved it an inch every time he went to the bathroom. And that's how I spent my entire day that day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The Japanese have this thing called shiatsu massage, where they dig into your body, very hard. And it is very painful. And apparently, some people throw up. But the next day they feel great. I've never had one. They sound awful.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Maybe Stanford would be cool.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's a good market. Higher volume.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Maybe we should both go.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I have a girlfriend...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sure you do, Dwight. Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, there's like, 300 more of these. Let's get to them later.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So, you going to transfer Jim or not?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe, I haven't decided yet. Let's get to work.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I want an answer by tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Oh... actually, tomorrow's not good. How about later in the week?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good. Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey! Wait. How about a group picture while you're here?

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: I can't. I only get reimbursed for the I.D. photos.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well... that's... what, a computer camera, right?

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: You mean digital?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It'll take like two seconds.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: 20 bucks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ugh... All right. Everybody, [looks around at the employees] come on. Group photo for the newsletter.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You gotta be kiddin' me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on, everybody.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on, let's go. Creed, Kevin, Oscar... andale! Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: One, two, three... smile. [camera flashes, but no one smiles] Try to smile.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We resolved a lot today, everybody. Think happy thoughts.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: Alright, I'm just gonna take it on three...  whether you smile or not. One, two, three. [camera flashes]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good, let's check that out. [looks at preview screen] Ew, okay, all right. One more. We'll take one more.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: That'll be another 20.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Angela, I want to talk to you about something.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [off camera] You just press the button.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [looks at to Jim] I am. [looks at Angela] It's about the Save The Date.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam, it wasn't her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm the one who complained about you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I... I didn't know that Toby was gonna write it down. [the camera flashes] I was just venting.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [off camera] Okay, good. Check that out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know, it was one day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [off camera] That's terrible.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And I took it right back. It was like...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, dear.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [off camera] Let's pay Mr. Price Gouger. [rejoins the group, on camera] Okay... we can do this. Come on, everybody. All right. Here we go. [flash goes off before he sits down]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was really hard getting a good picture of fifteen people. He would not give me a good discount. And eight tries added up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [flashback the photo being taken] One, two..[flash goes off] Didn't say three, did I?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: But, I'm sort of an expert at Photoshop, so it turned out fine in the end. When people work together, there is going to be conflict. You can't outrun your problems.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on Pam's answering machine] Hey, Pam... it's Jim. Um, I have a doctor's appointment in the city. So I probably won't be in till the late afternoon. Just thought I'd let you know. Okay, bye. [camera shows Jim sitting on a waiting coach in another Dunder Mifflin office]

quotes.speaker: Female Worker
quotes.text: Okay, Jan will see you now.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And that is why the idea of a cage match is so universally appealing. But here's the thing about cage matches: sometimes you have to open the cage. And that is something Toby will never understand.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [elevator bell dings] What is this? What happened here?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, this does not look good. Did anyone see what happened around my desk area this morning?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, I really think someone's probably just playing a prank on you, so just go right through it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: A prank, huh? This is official police line tape, okay? It's not a prank.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Probably is.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Damn it, people! Someone must have seen something! [Jim's cell phone beeping] Oh, you people are useless. Jesus.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [telephone ringing] Dunder Mifflin. This is Pam. Hold, please. Dwight, it's the Sheriff. He said that it's really important. It's regarding your desk. I'll transfer.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, no, no, don't! I can't... [groans] [telephone ringing]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Just cut through it, man, it's no big deal.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is why I'm a Volunteer Sheriff's Deputy and you're not.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That is not why. Wow, man, he really wants to get in touch with you. Maybe it's a murder.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, there's no blood.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Maybe poison?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Possibly.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: My God!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [exclaiming in fear] No, Jim, no! [Jim knocks Dwight's phone off its cradle] [yelling toward the phone] Sheriff, this is Volunteer Sheriff's Deputy Dwight Schrute. Press the pound key! What's your 20?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nothing much is happening today. We are having our photo IDs taken. Whoop-de-doo. Can't always be like The Apprentice.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: On Big Brother, something important happens every day. But real life is not like that.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: [Dwight slurping] Okay, here we go. One, two...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He sometimes wears glasses, write that down. Also, that may not be his real hair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I hate it when people don't tell each other why they're angry. My dad was like that. I would say, "What's wrong, Dad? What's wrong, Dad? What's wrong, Dad? What's wrong, Dad? What's wrong, Dad? What's wrong, Dad?" Over and over and over. And he would just look at me like I was an idiot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm the one who petitioned the office board to have these ID badges taken.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: So there were no death threats?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Let me see your ID.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There is this old story about two women who each think they are the mother of this baby. And they can't decide, so they bring the baby to a wise man. Just like a manager in those days. And the wise man says, "I will adopt this baby and raise it as a Hindu." See? They didn't expect that. And that fixed it. Because I think he was the dad anyway.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There are dozens of old complaints in here. Cold cases, like the show. [imitating gonging] And Toby is a lazy detective who has decided that these armed robberies and rapes and murder/suicides are not important enough to solve. Well, you know what? I have a problem with that. And I'm going to open up these cases before Toby can kill or rape another person.

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's not bad. Hey, do you do weddings?

quotes.speaker: Photographer
quotes.text: Would you seriously want your wedding photos to look like that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not bad.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I gave her a higher clearance than you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What does Level Red mean?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'd tell you, but then I'd have to kill you. [laughing maniacally]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Wait. [puts eye drops in] [Photographer takes the shot and her eyes are  closed]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No, wait. [put on a hat] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You must have misdialed. This is Phyllis. No, I'm not sure what his extension is. [glares at Stanley as he glares right back]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow! I never thought Dwight would go postal. It's always the person you least expect and I always thought Dwight would go postal.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Come on, Dwight, I think it's actually healthy to get it off your chest.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm done talking. I am a Schrute. We don't back down.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You're arrogant and pompous, and I don't like you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: "Cage Match"? I don't know if it was in the packet from corporate, because I barely read any of it. So if you're asking if I stole their idea, the answer is no.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: Excuse me, sir! Dwight Schrute, is that your real name?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes, sir.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Morning.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: Good morning. Okay, go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thank you. [elevator door closes] No, come on... God!
